exam.question: Physics is _______ to the science which was called natural philosophy in history.

answer.explain: be equivalent to： 与…相等的， 与…相当的， 与…等值的。句意： 物理相当于历史上所称的自然哲学。alike： 同样， 相似； likely： 很可能的， 适合的， 有希望的； uniform： 不变的； 一致的。

sentences.sContent: I had no dollars, but offered him an equivalent amount of sterling.
sentences.sCn: 我没有美金，但给了他等值的英镑。

sentences.sContent: ...the equivalent of two strong cups of coffee...
...Are they exhausted by the consumer equivalent of the brain fatigue — information overload — that is caused by constant updates of devices and online media...
...who’ll become Oxford’s vice-chancellor—a position equivalent to university president in America...
...they will see you in a way you never intended to be seen - the 21st century equivalent of being caught naked...

synos.tran: [物价][化学][数]等价的，相等的；同意义的

phrases.pCn: 等效应力；折算应力；相当应力

remMethod.val: equi(相等) ＋ val(强壮的) ＋ ent → 相等的， 等量的

trans.tranOther: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind
something that has the same value, purpose, job etc as something else
